com.algolia.instantsearch.helpers

Class InstantSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.algolia.instantsearch.helpers.InstantSearch

  • public class InstantSearch
extends java.lang.Object
    Uses the Searcher to react to changes in your application's interface, like when your user types a new query or interacts with Widgets. You can either use it with a single widget which will receive incoming results, or with several that will interact together in the same activity.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DELAY_PROGRESSBAR_NO_ANIMATIONS
      Delay before displaying progressbar when the current android API does not support animations.

    • Field Detail

      • DELAY_PROGRESSBAR_NO_ANIMATIONS

        public static final int DELAY_PROGRESSBAR_NO_ANIMATIONS
        Delay before displaying progressbar when the current android API does not support animations. (API < 14)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • InstantSearch

        public InstantSearch(@NonNull
                     android.app.Activity activity,
                     @NonNull
                     Searcher searcher)
        Constructs the helper, then link it to the given Activity and register its Widgets.
        Parameters:
        activity - a searchable Activity containing at least one AlgoliaResultsListener to update with incoming results.
        searcher - the Searcher to use with this activity.

      • InstantSearch

        public InstantSearch(@NonNull
                     android.app.Activity activity,
                     @NonNull
                     android.view.Menu menu,
                     @IdRes
                     int menuItemId,
                     @NonNull
                     Searcher searcher)
        Constructs the helper, then link it to the given Activity and register its Widgets / its Menu's searchView.
        Parameters:
        activity - a searchable Activity containing at least one AlgoliaResultsListener to update with incoming results.
        menu - the Menu which contains your SearchView.
        menuItemId - the SearchView item's id in your Menu.
        searcher - the Searcher to use with this activity.

        Triggers a new search with the given text.

      • registerSearchView

        public void registerSearchView(@NonNull
                               android.app.Activity activity,
                               @NonNull
                               android.view.Menu menu,
                               int id)
        Registers the Search Widget of an Activity's Menu to trigger search requests on text change, replacing the current one if any.
        Parameters:
        activity - The searchable Activity, see SearchableInfo.
        menu - The Menu that contains a search item.
        id - The identifier of the menu's search item.

      • registerSearchView

        public void registerSearchView(@NonNull
                               android.app.Activity activity,
                               @NonNull
                               android.widget.SearchView searchView)
        Registers a SearchView to trigger search requests on text change, replacing the current one if any.
        Parameters:
        activity - The searchable activity, see SearchableInfo.
        searchView - a SearchView whose query text will be used.

      • registerSearchView

        public void registerSearchView(@NonNull
                               android.app.Activity activity,
                               @NonNull
                               android.support.v7.widget.SearchView searchView)
        Registers a SearchView to trigger search requests on text change, replacing the current one if any.
        Parameters:
        activity - The searchable activity, see SearchableInfo.
        searchView - a SearchView whose query text will be used.

      • registerSearchView

        public void registerSearchView(@NonNull
                               android.app.Activity activity,
                               SearchBoxViewModel searchBoxViewModel)
        Registers a SearchViewModel to trigger search requests on text change, replacing the current one if any.
        Parameters:
        activity - The searchable activity, see SearchableInfo.
        searchBoxViewModel - a SearchBoxViewModel which SearchView's query text will be used.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the search interface and state via Searcher.reset(), broadcasting a ResetEvent.

      • enableProgressBar

        public void enableProgressBar(int delay)
        Enables the display of a spinning ProgressBar in the SearchView when waiting for results.
        Parameters:
        delay - a delay to wait between firing a request and displaying the indicator.

      • enableProgressBar

        public void enableProgressBar()
        Enables the display of a spinning ProgressBar in the SearchView when waiting for results.

      • disableProgressBar

        public void disableProgressBar()
        Disables the ProgressBar, removing it if it is already displayed.

                            android.view.ViewGroup rootView)
        TODO: Ensure developer calls before displaying widget! Registers your facet filters, adding them to this InstantSearch's widgets.
        Parameters:
        rootView - a ViewGroup containing one or several AlgoliaFilters.

      • registerFilters

        public void registerFilters(java.util.List<AlgoliaFilter> filters)
        Registers your facet filters, adding them to this InstantSearch's widgets.
        Parameters:
        filters - a List of facet filters.

      • setSearchOnEmptyString

        public void setSearchOnEmptyString(boolean searchOnEmptyString)
        Enables or disables the sending of a search request when the SearchView becomes empty (default is true).
        Parameters:
        searchOnEmptyString - if true, a request will be fired.

      • hasSearchOnEmptyString

        public boolean hasSearchOnEmptyString()
        Tells if an empty string in the searchBoxViewModel is a valid search query.
        Returns:
        true if an empty string triggers a search request.

      • registerWidget

        public void registerWidget(android.view.View widget)
        Links the given widget to InstantSearch according to the interfaces it implements.
        Parameters:
        widget - a widget implementing (AlgoliaResultsListener || AlgoliaErrorListener || AlgoliaSearcherListener).
